text: Tomorrow, the House will pass legislation that will prohibit the sales of “ghost gun” kits without a background check or serial numbers stamped on the parts used in assembling the weapon. (2/2)

Ghost guns must be treated as the deadly firearms that they are! These firearm kits are often sold online and are typically untraceable and have fueled an epidemic of gun violence. (1/2)
https://t.co/6j1mgpofcb

As Member of Congress who is proud to have an "F" rating from the NRA, tomorrow I will vote to pass legislation that will help raise the age to 21 for those who wish to buy a semi-automatic rifle. (2/2)

Raise the age at the Federal level for buying semi-automatic rifles from 18 to 21!

(1/2)
https://t.co/NtFKOQBp9X
The horrific mass shootings in Buffalo and Texas shook our country. If there ever was a time for legislation that would strengthen and enhance efforts to keep our communities safe, that time is now.

We are the only country where gun violence massacres routinely happen. We are better than this. This week the House will vote and pass common sense legislation to help end gun violence, keep our communities safe, and keep guns out of the hands of criminals.

More than 4,000 Allied soldiers, sailors, airmen, and coastguardsmen perished on the 24-hour period known as D-Day. 

The best way to honor their sacrifice on the altar of freedom is to make our democracy work. (2/2)

On June 6, 1944, 156,000 American, British and Canadian forces conducted the largest amphibious military assaults in history on the beaches of Normandy.

It was the turning point of World War II. 
(1/2) https://t.co/dspNVdpOZt

Today is National Gun Violence Awareness Day. We are the only country where these gun violence massacres happens. We are better than this. Let’s come together and find a way to end the gun violence that fills us with anxiety and despair. #EndGunViolence https://t.co/OnzT9GasUH
